name: 5-bromoindole
Reason: 5-bromoindole is a derivative of indole, which has a melting point of 52-54°C. The bromine atom is a heavy halogen atom, which can increase the melting point due to its size and electronegativity. The bromine atom can form a halogen bond with the indole nitrogen atom, which can increase the melting point by approximately +10°C. The bromine atom can also increase the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, which can increase the melting point by approximately +20°C. The net effect of the bromine atom is a melting point increase of approximately +30°C.
